cards.question: What is jQuery?
cards.answer: Dynamically inserting, updating or removing HTML.  Registering click or other change events. Animating HTML elements. Download data from databases.

cards.question: jQuery is JavaScript library or JSON library?
What scripting language is jQuery written in?
Which sign does jQuery use as a shortcut for jQuery?
Is jQuery a library for client scripting or server scripting?
What is CDN?
cards.answer: Content Delivery Network (CDN) is a system of computers that exist all over the world and cache files for users to access. CDNs can greatly reduce the load time of a page by offering files at a higher bandwidth from a server that is physically closer to your visitor than your web server might be.

cards.question: What does this code represent for? <script   src='https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.3.1.min.js'   integrity='sha256-FgpCb/KJQlLNfOu91ta32o/NMZxltwRo8QtmkMRdAu8='   crossorigin='anonymous'></script>
Where do you place jQuery code?
cards.answer: adding a line in between the opening (< head >) and closing (< /head >) HTML header tags.
